channel.title: Java Compiling and Running TUT
channel.description:
This tut is about compiling a java file and running it please visit the stickies on [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,70709.0.html]seting up java and jdk[/url] before coming here.(credit to ilyaostr9 for making that topic)
Contents: 1. Creating an all purpose Java "Processor" 2. Compiling 3. Running #1 \ALTERNATES 4. Running #2 /
Your Java Processor: 1.Create a txt file should look like this [img]http://img95.imageshack.us/img95/4638/textks8.jpg[/img]
2. Type These commands into it [code] cmd @tittle Java Processor Javac [/code] Should Look like this [img]http://img441.imageshack.us/img441/911/text2sm2.jpg[/img]
3. Save as JavaProcessor.bat Should look like this [img]http://img225.imageshack.us/img225/8813/text3ig7.jpg[/img]
4. You now have a Processor!
Compiling your Java Files: 1. Run your Java Processor
2. Type [code]javac FILENAME.JAVA[/code]
NOTE:if it compiled it wont give you errors if it does fix your program!
Running your Java Files #1: 1. Run the Java Processor
2. Type [code]Java FILENAME[/code]
3. if it was compiled correctly it will run
Running Java Files #2: 1. Create a new bat file
2. Type these commands [code]java -classpath . FILENAME[/code]
NOTE: this is just an alternate method!
STICKIE IF YOU WANT!

and when you set your environmental classpath, it should always include .

item.title: Java Compiling and Running TUT
item.dc:creator: @killer-christian killer-christian
item.description:
@killer-christian wrote:

This tut is about compiling a java file and running it please visit the stickies on seting up java and jdk before coming here.(credit to ilyaostr9 for making that topic)

Contents:

  1. Creating an all purpose Java “Processor”
  2. Compiling
  3. Running #1 \ALTERNATES
  4. Running #2 /

Your Java Processor:
1.Create a txt file
should look like this

  1. Type These commands into it
cmd
@tittle Java Processor
Javac

Should Look like this

  1. Save as JavaProcessor.bat
    Should look like this

  2. You now have a Processor!

Compiling your Java Files:

  1. Run your Java Processor

  2. Type

javac FILENAME.JAVA

NOTE:if it compiled it wont give you errors if it does fix your program!

Running your Java Files #1:

  1. Run the Java Processor

  2. Type

Java FILENAME
  1. if it was compiled correctly it will run

Running Java Files #2:

  1. Create a new bat file

  2. Type these commands

java -classpath . FILENAME

NOTE: this is just an alternate method!

STICKIE IF YOU WANT!

Read full topic
